intro: Piratinera lemeei, commonly known as the Lemon Tree of the Andes, is a small evergreen shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Its botanical features include glossy foliage and a compact growth habit, making it suitable for ornamental purposes in gardens. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
